newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey 97/98 wheat crop may fall short of 18 mln T.
newsitem.headline: Turkey 97/98 wheat crop may fall short of 18 mln T.

text.p: Turkey's wheat crop for 1997/98 may fall below the official target of 18 million tonnes, a senior farm official said on Friday.
This was because of lower-than-expected rains in May after good rains in April.
"The target was 18 million tonnes but look at the weather in May. I think we may have less than the target," said the official.
Turkey produced about 16.5 million tonnes of wheat in 1996/97.
The official told Reuters the crop estimate figure might change but he did not think it would come close to the target. He did not give other details.
Weather analysts have said rains were good in April but poor in May.
They said rainfall was some six percent below average in the October-April period throughout Turkey.
